field.label: Enabled
field.help: Enable this certificate. When disabled, no attemps to issue or renew the certificate will be made.

field.label: Common Name
field.help: Common Name (CN) and first Alt Name (subjectAltName) for this certificate.

field.label: Alt Names
field.help:
Configure additional names that should be part of the certificate, i.e. www.example.com or mail.example.com. Use TAB key to complete typing a FQDN.
NOTE:You need to forcefully re-issue the certificate if you change "Alt Names" after the certificate was signed by the ACME CA! Use the "issue" button in the Commands column in this case.
field.hint: Enter FQDN here. Finish with TAB.

field.label: ACME Account
field.help: Set the ACME CA account to use for this certificate.

field.label: Challenge Type
field.help: Set the ACME challenge type for this certificate.

field.label: Auto Renewal
field.help: Enable automatic renewal for this certificate to prevent expiration. When disabled, the cron job will ignore this certificate. Note that it is still possible to renew the certificate from the GUI.

field.label: Renewal Interval
field.help: Specifies the days to renew the cert. The max value is 60 days.

field.label: Key Length
field.help: Specify the domain key length: 2048, 3072, 4096, 8192 or ec-256, ec-384.

field.label: OCSP Must Staple
field.help: Generate and add OCSP Must Staple extension to the certificate.

field.label: Automations
field.help: Choose the automations that should be run after certificate creation and renewal. Basically every application requires a quick restart to reload the updated certificate. If you don't configure an automation, the in-memory certificate may expire and cause security warnings and other issues.

field.label: DNS Alias Mode
field.help: Configure DNS alias mode to validate the certificate.

field.label: Domain Alias
field.help: When setting DNS alias mode to "Domain Alias", enter the domain name that should be used for certificate validation. Please refer to the acme.sh documentation for further information.

field.label: Challenge Alias
field.help: When setting DNS alias mode to "Challenge Alias", enter the domain name that should be used for certificate validation. Please refer to the acme.sh documentation for further information.
